summary: the wheels crack / bend won't hold air in normal driving

I drive my corvette about 3000 miles per year, no highway, never in the rain. I took my GS in for new tires and was informed the driver side rear wheel was cracked and leaking air. I have never hit a bump, drove it on a track, drove on deflated tires etc. Makes no sense the rim would be cracked.

I PURCHASED MY VEHICLE IN DECEMBER OF 2017. AROUND DECEMBER 2019, MY LEFT REAR WHEEL STARTED TO LOSE AIR. I ASSUMED THAT THE TIRE NEEDED TO BE REPAIRED OR REPLACED. I TOOK MY VEHICLE TO A TIRE SHOP AND THEY COULD NOT FIND ANYTHING WRONG WITH THE TIRE. AFTER FURTHER INVESTIGATION, A HAIR-LINE CRACK WAS DISCOVERED IN THE WHEEL. THERE WAS NO INDICATION OF AN IMPACT, OR DAMAGE ON THE SURFACE OF THE WHEEL, ON THE INSIDE THE WHEEL OR EVEN ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE WHEEL AND THEY ARE NOT BENT OR SCRATCHED ANYWHERE ON THE RIM. MY CAR WAS STILL UNDER WARRANTY, SO I TOOK THE VEHICLE TO MY LOCAL DEALERSHIP AND  GENERAL MOTORS REFUSED TO REPLACE THE WHEEL ON MY VEHICLE. I CALLED GENERAL MOTORS MYSELF AND FILED A COMPLAINT AND TO APPEAL THEIR DECISION NOT TO REPLACE MY WHEEL. AFTER REPEATED ATTEMPTS, GENERAL MOTORS STILL REFUSED TO REPLACE THE WHEEL ON MY VEHICLE. MY VEHICLE IS NO LONGER UNDER WARRANTY AND TWO ADDITIONAL WHEELS NOW HAVE THE SAME ISSUE, ONE WILL NO LONGER HOLD ANY AIR. I CANNOT DRIVE MY VEHICLE UNTIL MY RIMS ARE REPLACED. I ORDERED A NEW SET FOR $3K AT MY EXPENSE. PLEASE NOTE, THAT I HAVE NOT BEEN IN AN ACCIDENT, NOR IS THERE ANY DAMAGE ON THE SURFACE OF THE WHEEL. THERE MUST BE A MANUFACTURING OR DESIGN DEFECT...I KEEP THE VEHICLE IN MY GARAGE, IT'S PAMPERED AND GETS DRIVEN LESS THAN 7K MILES PER YEAR IN SUNNY FLORIDA WHERE THERE ARE NO POT HOLES OR TERRIBLE ROAD CONDITIONS; EVERYTHING IS FLAT AND SMOOTH. I BECAME AWARE THAT THERE ARE THOUSANDS OF COMPLAINTS OF THIS EXACT ISSUE WHILE READING THE CORVETTE FORUM FOR THESE RIMS. THERE IS POTENTIALLY A HORRIBLE RISK TO SOMEONES LIFE IS THIS ISSUE ISN'T CORRECTED FOR SOME UNKNOWING VICTIM. PLEASE INVESTIGATE THE ISSUE WITH THESE RIMS AND FORCE GM TO ISSUE A SAFETY RECAL FOR THIS SAFETY ISSUE. I BELIEVE THAT THERE ARE THOUSANDS OF UNSUSPECTING DRIVERS THAT HAVE THE SAME ISSUE WITH THIER VEHICLE THAT ARE UNAWARE OF THIS DEADLY SAFETY HAZARD. PLEASE HELP CORVETTE OWNERS DRIVING SAFETY, EVEN IF GM REFUSES TO DO SO!
MY REAR RIMS CRACKED MULITPLE TIMES. I HAD GOTTEN THEM FIXED BUT GOT TIRED OF FIXING THEM AND ACCUMULATED AROUND 5-8 CRACKS IN TOTAL FOR MY REAR RIMS.

The contact owns a 2017 Chevrolet Corvette. The contact stated that the TPMS warning light had illuminated on the instrument panel. Upon inspection, the contact discovered that the rear passenger’s and driver’s rims were cracked. The driver’s side rim had one crack and the passenger’s side rim two cracks. The vehicle had yet to be serviced or diagnosed for the failure. The dealer nor the manufacturer have yet to be notified of the failure. The vehicle had yet to be repaired. The failure mileage was approximately 22,000.

March of 2019:  I had unexpected flat tires, one front and one rear.  There was no warning nor reason to suspect any damage. Took the car to the shop and had cracked wheels.  As most Corvette owners, I pamper this car and would know/remember hitting anything.  I replaced the wheels at my expense after getting no help from the Chevrolet dealer.  The attached photo shows there was no impact- just a big crack. December 2021: I have one unexpected rear flat tire.  Found another crack.   Unexpected flat tires without warning is an obvious safety concern for me and anyone around me as I drive.  After looking on the internet, there are 100's of complaints about this and multiple class-action lawsuits.  This should be forced to be a recall and the government should step in. I am surprised that this has reached this point, as a risk analysis engineer.  The field complaints have reached a point where the occurrence rate and the severity of the failure should flag action.  Earlier in my career, I designed and tested wheels as a tier 1 supplier to GM.  I know how GM Tire and Wheel operate. There are specs for impact and fatigue testing and I bet the poor design is very well understood.  I hope you can help.

This is a common problem with the OEM wheels bent that precludes proper and unsafe use. Tire inflation and balance along with vibrations are a major safety concern. I would like GM to do a recall on these wheels and help the owners for replacements with a forged aluminum wheel as opposed to the engineering mistakes made using a cast alluminum wheel.

The contact owns a 2017 Chevrolet Corvette. The contact stated that while getting his tires replaced by a tire dealer, the tire dealer informed him that the rear passenger’s side rim was cracked in two places. The vehicle was taken to the dealer for an alignment and was informed by the dealer that there were two cracks on the rear passenger’s side rim and the rim was out of round caused by hitting potholes. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was not made aware of the failure. The failure mileage was 23,341.

The Contact owns a 2017 Chevrolet Corvette. The contact stated that the four tires were replaced. After the tires were replaced, the tire pressure warning light illuminated. The tires were inspected, and the contact noticed that the passenger’s side rear tire was leaking air. The vehicle was taken back to the dealer for inspection. The dealer found that the passenger’s side rear wheel was fractured. The contact was informed that the wheel might have struck an object causing the failure. The contact denied striking any objects while driving. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was contacted. The failure mileage was 18,000.

My left rear wheel developed a crack.  Luckily I noticed this quickly, or a catastrophic failure could have occurred leading to loss of vehicle control and potential crash.  These failures are well documented on the web, with 100's of owners experiencing the same failure.  GM made a poor engineering/cost decision when deciding to use cast wheels on a high performance car with a large drum overhang and stiff low profile tires.  Forged wheels are much stronger and should have used in this application.  A GM dealership has looked at the problem and did contact GM.  As with all the other cases, they refuse to take responsibility.  Some people have gotten reimbursed for their cost by GM after arbitration via the BBB.

I have had two rear wheels crack in multiple places which  required me to buy new wheels, GM refused any warranty claim and referred me to the dealer, the dealer put me on hold for ten to 20 minutes  3 times and refused to talk to me about the problem. The first wheel broke  at27,000, the second at 38,000 miles

I HAD TO REPLACE MY FIRST WHEEL WITHIN THE 1ST MONTHS (WAS LEAKING AIR FROM A CRACK IN THE WHEEL).  A COUPLE MONTHS AFTER THAT I TOOK MY CAR IN TO GET NEW TIRES AND WAS INFORMED THAT TWO MORE WHEELS HAD CRACKS IN THEM.  I HAD THEM WELDED.  IN JULY, I WAS LOSING AIR IN ANOTHER WHEEL AND FOUND IT HAD A CRACK AND HAD TO HAVE THE WHEEL REPLACED.    I ONLY DRIVE IN TOUR MODE (SOFTER SUSPENSION) AND EVEN PAID TO GET A SUSPENSION SOFTWARE UPDATE FROM GM IN THE SUMMER TO SUPPOSEDLY SOFTEN THE RIDE AFTER READING OF OTHERS HAVING THIS ISSUE, IT DID NOT HELP TO STOP THE ISSUES.  I HAVE BEEN DRIVING IN THE SAME AREAS FOR OVER TWENTY YEARS, HAD MULTIPLE OTHER SPORTS CARS AND NEVER HAD ANY OTHER DAMAGED WHEEL BESIDES THIS CAR.  IT IS CLEAR THAT THE STOCK WHEELS ARE NOT STRONG ENOUGH FOR THIS HEAVY WIDE BODY CAR AND THEY NEED FORGED WHEELS THAT I CAN'T AFFORD.  TO RECAP, I HAVE ABOUT 10,000 MILES ON THE CAR NOW AND OVER THE APPROX. 5,000 MILES THAT I HAVE DROVE IT, THERE HAVE BEEN 4 WHEELS THAT HAD CRACKS ON THE INNER SIDE OF THE WHEELS, WITH NO TIRE OR OTHER DAMAGE VISIBLE.

WHILE DRIVING THE CAR, I CONTINUED TO NOTICE A VIBRATION. IT VARIED WITH SPEED AND AT TIMES WOULD BE WORSE THAN AT OTHER TIMES. THIS IS KNOWN AS A "BEAT FREQUENCY". I FINALLY BECAME VERY CONCERNED, RAISED THE CAR AND FOUND BOTH PASSENGER SIDE RIMS TO BE BENT. I HAD ONLY HAD THE CAR FOR 6 MONTHS. IT CAME FROM A HENDRICK DEALERSHIP. IT IS MORE THAN APPARENT THIS IS ANOTHER COVER UP BY GM. I HAVE A 2012 KIA FORTE THAT IS DRIVEN ON THE SAME EXACT ROADS. IT COST $12,OOO AND HAS NEVER BENT A WHEEL. THE CORVETTE Z06 MSRP WAS $105,000. I HAD TO PURCHASE ANOTHER SET OF WHEELS. GM IS NOT CAPABLE OF PRODUCING A CAR THAT IS ENGINEERED CORRECTLY.

WHEN DRIVING THE CAR VIBRATED. I TOOK THE CAR TO THE LOCAL CHEVY DEALER TO GET THE WHEELS BALANCED AND WAS TOLD TWO OF THE WHEELS COULD NOT BE BALANCED BECAUSE THEY WERE BENT. IN SPITE OF MY 3YR, 36K MILE BUMPER TO BUMPER WARRANTY (WHICH WAS IN FORCE) I WAS TOLD CHEVY WOULD NOT COVER THE COST OF REPAIRS.

SOON AFTER BUYING THE CAR IN MAY 2018, HAD TO REPLACE 3 OF THE 4 RIMS FOR BEING BENT.  I DIDN'T HIT ANY POTHOLES OR ANYTHING.  HAD TO PAY OUT OF POCKET BECAUSE GM WOULD NOT WARRANTY THE RIMS.    ON SEP 26,2020; ONE OF THE REPLACED RIMS (MENTIONED ABOVE) CRACKED AND STARTED LEAKING (LEFT REAR).  ALL I DO IS NORMAL DRIVING AND DO NOT HIT POT HOLES ETC.
